document.title: Ohio’s Learning Standards for Fine Arts: Music 2024

9187F465823E4D519D6C61ED1E25756F.description:
Interpret copyright law and discover how
someone can protect a composition once the individual
has composed or created a work.

C0DBDE9991A84043A7F9C8EE2C669A19.description:
Select personal music experiences that
represent well-developed performance skills, abilities,
and accomplishments (developing a portfolio,
preparing college audition, studio work).

FDC9432DA3284A1E8D35C0367754D23E.description:
Explain how the roles of creators,
performers, and others involved in the production and
presentation of each of the arts are similar and different.

B97B3CB0846C43ED9D74E0EF80C5AC3F.description:
Analyze various performance works from a
variety of world cultures, identifying the unique features
of expression, and determine how these characteristics
contribute to performance style while minimizing
stylistic bias.

8FA531D555A448979B15C76AA7F5E7DD.description: Connecting: Artists/students understand and communicate the value of creative expressions in internal and external contexts.

6818AFCDC8A74181A2DE425BE0BC5B84.description:
Use student-developed criteria to select music,
organize, and present an individual performance showing
mastery of the selected music.

1F27E603CA1F4B89B8EFDA638682CB1A.description:
Justify interpretations of the expressive intent,
emotion, and meaning of musical works by comparing and
explaining varied researched sources, including reference to
other art forms.

ADD9ACEA4C164C9B96B05BE31E9925C1.description:
Develop and apply criteria to critique the
ensemble performance with a focus on pitch, rhythm,
characteristic tone quality and intonation, use of dynamics
and articulation, appropriate style, and expression.

9DC1467A026B4C8D95F12A225285A037.description: Responding: Artists/students engage in analysis and interpretation to understand and evaluate artistic works.

81C58C51FE0A43F8BEF4CEF89A2C0DAB.description:
Respond appropriately to the cues of the
conductor.

64DB487DC32843688B678C9A9048B11C.description:
Develop, apply, and refine appropriate rehearsal
strategies to address various individual and ensemble
challenges in a varied repertoire of music during the
rehearsal process.

F8910F86D8344594B33428F1874C22B7.description:
Perform a varied repertoire of prepared and
improvised music, representing a variety of cultures, styles,
time periods, and genres in several types of ensembles.

193A650FC303414E9D7905229025EF35.description:
Perform compositions intended for sight
reading with correct pitches, correct rhythms,
characteristic tone, accurate intonation, printed dynamics,
printed articulations, and appropriate style for the music
being performed and musical expression.

05867EDF28A64CCB8E7CF30087BCDD18.description:
Perform prepared or improvised music showing
mastery of technical accuracy and expression in several
types of ensembles.

8F20380D77CF4052A1CACCA4AA538471.description:
Demonstrate proficiency in all major and minor
keys and a chromatic scale in multiple octaves as
appropriate. Demonstrate proficiency singing pentatonic;
major; natural, harmonic, and melodic minor scales and
keys; and chromatic, octatonic, and whole-tone scales, plus
modes as appropriate.

D7BB21B138784C90ACFBB440B1A43091.description:
Play or sing with a characteristic tone quality,
perform a full range of pitches with accurate intonation,
understand intonation tendencies, adjust during the
performance, and utilize concepts of just intonation.

4F945CAE64254FB2B5DA24F628C6FCA0.description:
Read and perform with correct pitches, correct
rhythms, printed dynamics, printed articulations,
appropriate style, and musical expression for the music
being performed.

A246DCBF53C1409FAD776DA28E794715.description: Performing: Artists/students employ personal processes and skills to solve problems creatively and present work in various contexts.

2A5536465DC6437BAEE21483B101A759.description:
Defend the purpose of tuning
instruments.

84FA73F7402B4275A5E941EA0824872E.description:
Evaluate and refine a variety of musical
works based on appropriate criteria and evaluate if
the music meets the established criteria.

BD85CE539E33477D91E0DBE6D09AF31F.description:
Select, develop, and notate or record
melodic and rhythmic ideas into full musical works
intended for a variety of purposes and contexts.

45FE239775F54E54BFE4F2A7D3DDD5D8.description:
Compose and improvise musical
compositions for a variety of purposes and
contexts.

93C9EFB16114445A88B996AB488E83CB.description: Creating: Artists/students use creative thinking and reasoning skills to perceive concepts and ideas to develop works.
